medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 36 hours prior to presentation; pain started in the mid abdomen and localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) about 12 hours later. The pain is constant and sharp. The patient continues to pass flatus and has not had a bowel movement since symptom onset. He has not tolerated diet since pain started. Associated symptoms include low grade fevers, chills, and sweats.
